app.models package¶

Submodules¶

app.models.helpers module¶

Convenience functions which interact with SQLAlchemy models.

class app.models.helpers.Base(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Convenience base DB model class. Makes sure tables in MySQL are created as InnoDB.

This is to enforce foreign key constraints (MyISAM doesn’t support constraints) outside of production. Tables are also named to avoid collisions.

id = Column(None, Integer(), table=None, primary_key=True)¶

Primary key for SQL Alchemy models.

app.models.opportunities module¶

Opportunities model

Currently just opportunity

class app.models.opportunities.Opportunity(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: app.models.helpers.Base

Opportunity model to store an opportunity

add_required_material(required_material)[source]¶

Adds the required material to the user

Parameters:required_material (str) – The required material to add.
check_required_material(required_material)[source]¶

Checks the required material for a user.

Parameters:required_material (str) – The required material to check.
Returns:bool – true if the user has the required material, false if otherwise
deadline¶

Column to store the deadline for applying to an opportunity, as a datetime object.

description¶

Column to store the description, as a string.

end_time¶

Column to store the end time for the opportunity, as a datetime object.

hours¶

Column to store the hours per week, on average, that an opportunity may entail, as a number.

id¶
link¶

Column to store the link to either information about an opportunity, or the application.

name¶

Column to store the name, as a string.

organization¶

Column to store the organization, as a string.

remove_required_material(required_material)[source]¶

Removes the required material from the user

Returns true if the user had the required material and successfully deleted it. Returns false if the user doesn’t have the required_material.

Parameters:required_material (str) – The required material to remove.
Returns:bool - true if the required material was successfully deleted, false if the user didn’t have the required material
required_materials¶

Relationship Column creating the one-to-many relationship for the required material table. It operates like a list.

start_time¶

Column to store the start time for the opportunity, as a datetime object.

tags¶

Relationship Column to store the many to many to the tags. It operates like a list.

users_following¶

Relationship Column to store the many to many to the users. It operates like a list.

app.models.permissions module¶

Permissions models

Currently just Role

class app.models.permissions.Role(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: app.models.helpers.Base

Role base to store a user’s role

id¶
role¶

Column to store the role, as a string.

Current values used:
  • ‘user’
  • ‘admin’
user_id¶

Column storing the ForeignKey for the user

app.models.relationships module¶

A file to store all the tables for any and all many to many relationships

app.models.relationships.opportunities_following = Table(‘opportunities_following’, MetaData(bind=None), Column(‘opportunity.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘opportunity.id’), table=<opportunities_following>), Column(‘user.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘user.id’), table=<opportunities_following>), schema=None)¶

Table setting up the many to many relationship between opportunities and users

app.models.relationships.tags = Table(‘tags’, MetaData(bind=None), Column(‘opportunity.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘opportunity.id’), table=<tags>), Column(‘tag.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘tag.id’), table=<tags>), schema=None)¶

Table setting up the many to many relationship between opportunities and tags

app.models.relationships.tags_following = Table(‘tags_following’, MetaData(bind=None), Column(‘tag.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘tag.id’), table=<tags_following>), Column(‘user.id’, Integer(), ForeignKey(‘user.id’), table=<tags_following>), schema=None)¶

Table setting up the many to many relationship between users and tags

Returns:bool - true if the role was successfully deleted, false if the user didn’t have the role
